interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Child's Play [DVD]
Review Date: 2019/07/05
Store: Catherine Hicks  (Actor),     Chris Sarandon  (Actor),     Tom Holland  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, MGM Home Entertainment, All MGM Titles
Product Description: ['The "chills come thick and fast" (Los Angeles Times) as voodoo and terror meet within an innocent-looking doll inhabited by the soul of a serial killer who isn\'t ready to die. From the Director of Fright Night comes a "clever, playful" (The New York Times) and stylish thriller with "excellent special effects" (Leonard Maltin) and heart-pounding suspense guaranteed to scare! After 6-year-old Andy Barclay\'s (Alex Vincent) babysitter is violently pushed out of a window to her death, nobody believes him when he says that "Chucky," his new birthday doll, did it! Untilthings start going terribly wrong dead wrong. And when an ensuing rampage of gruesome murders lead a detective (Chris Sarandon) back to the same toy, he discovers that the real terror has just begun\'the deranged doll has plans to transfer his evil spirit into a living human beingyoung Andy!']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Mystery & Thrillers', 'Format': 'Closed-captioned, DVD, NTSC, Color, Full Screen', 'Contributor': 'Brad Dourif, Raymond Oliver, Alex Vincent, Juan Ramrez, Alan Wilder, Dinah Manoff, Chris Sarandon, Tommy Swerdlow, Catherine Hicks, John Lafia, Jack Colvin, Tom Holland, Richard Baird, Don Mancini, Neil GiuntoliBrad Dourif, Raymond Oliver, Alex Vincent, Juan Ramrez, Alan Wilder, Dinah Manoff, Chris Sarandon, Tommy Swerdlow, Catherine Hicks, John Lafia, Jack Colvin, Tom Holland, Richard Baird, Don Mancini, Neil Giuntoli  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Tom Holland', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, DVD, NTSC, Color, Full Screen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 28, 1999', 'Actors': 'Catherine Hicks, Chris Sarandon, Alex Vincent, Brad Dourif, Dinah Manoff', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'MGM (Video & DVD)', 'Writers': 'Don Mancini, John Lafia, Tom Holland', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Kind of confused because I ordered the movie Child's Play, but received it as part of a three part movie disc with Amityville Horror and Carrie. I guess it was ok, but I only wanted Child's Play. So, not sure what anyone else will get.
Review Title: You get the movie, but.........
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Electric Horseman
Robert Redford  (Actor),     Jane Fonda  (Actor),     Sydney Pollack  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
["Robert Redford plays an ex-world champion cowboy, reduced to huckstering breakfast food in a suit studded with flashing lights. Jane Fonda is a chic, sharp member of the electronic media, a TV newswoman who'll do anything to get a good story. When Redford rides out of a Las Vegas casino into the desert astride his sponsor's living symbol, a multi-million dollar racehorse, Jane is determined to discover why. She does, one step ahead of a posse of pursuing police. But by the time they reach a remote rendezvous high in the Utah mountains, she is in love with both the cowboy and his convictions.Bonus Content:", 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Recommendations', 'Recommendations']

Perfect feel-good movie. Redford and Fonda have amazing chemistry. Beautiful scenery as they journey to free the horse. You won't be disappointed.
Great!

profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Media Preferences:** Enjoys feel-good movies across action, adventure, and drama genres while also engaging with select thrillers, indicating a broadening interest in suspenseful narratives.
- **Actor Affinity:** Prefers films featuring iconic actors like Robert Redford and Jane Fonda but also enjoys performances by actors like Catherine Hicks and Chris Sarandon, showcasing an appreciation for diverse talent.
- **Themes:** Prefers narratives that include personal convictions and the human-animal bond, with a newfound exploration of horror and suspense themes.
- **Emotional Engagement:** Seeks uplifting or memorable entertainment but displays an openness to engaging stories that induce feelings of suspense and thrill, as evidenced by a favorable rating for a horror film.
- **Viewing Format:** Continues to favor physical media formats such as DVD, reflecting a traditional approach to movie-watching.
- **Visual Aesthetics:** Values beautiful cinematography and scenic settings, important for both uplifting and thrilling films.

Overall, the user demonstrates a preference for engaging, character-driven stories with strong performances that resonate emotionally and visually, while also showing an expanding interest in thrillers and horror that challenge their viewing experience.
